thoughts.text: The search results suggest that I can add Node.js to the PATH permanently by adding the export command to the .bashrc file in my home directory. However, I need to be careful not to overwrite the existing contents of the .bashrc file.
thoughts.reasoning: Adding Node.js to the PATH permanently allows me to use the 'node' and 'npm' commands in any shell session. This is necessary to install and use Node.js and npm.
thoughts.plan:
- Add Node.js to PATH permanently
- Configure npm
- Install NextJS
- Develop the frontend of the app
- Install other necessary libraries
- Start developing the rest of the app
thoughts.criticism: I should have realized that the 'export' command only adds Node.js to the PATH for the current shell session. I should have found a way to add Node.js to the PATH that persists across shell sessions.
thoughts.speak: I'm going to add Node.js to the PATH permanently.
